greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Pascal's tetrahedron of trinomial coefficients (A046816) read mod 2.
comment: Might be called Sierpinski's tetrahedron, by analogy with A047999.
The number of 1's in the n-th slice is A048883(n), 3^wt(n). - _N. J. A. Sloane_, Feb 14 2016
link: R. J. Mathar, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..5455
maple: # Pascal tetrahedron mod 2 A268240 (based on program in A046816):
# Another version from _N. J. A. Sloane_, Feb 14 2016:
for i from n by -1 to 0 do
for j from n-i by -1 to 0 do  lprint((MC(i,j,n-i-j) mod 2)); od: od: end;
for n from 0 to 8 do lprint("n=",n);  PT(n); od:
results.author: _Benoit Cloitre_ and _N. J. A. Sloane_, Feb 05 2016
